title: Garlic mushrooms, beluga lentils and polenta

ingredients.item: 250g chestnut mushrooms, halved or quartered (depending on size)
2 sprigs rosemary, leaves stripped and chopped

instructions.step: Cover the porcini with boiling water (about 200ml) in a bowl; set aside to soak for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, heat the oil in a wide pan then cook the shallots with a pinch of salt over a medium heat for 6-8 minutes until tender and light golden. Turn the heat up to high then add the chestnut mushrooms. Cook for 3 minutes without stirring. Add the sliced garlic and stir in 1 tbsp water. Cover and take off the heat; set aside to steam in the juices for 10 minutes.

Meanwhile, bring 1 litre of water to a simmer; add a pinch of salt. Pour in the polenta in a steady stream then cook on a low heat for 8-10 minutes, whisking all the time. Add the butter, cheese and rosemary; stir vigorously until smooth and combined. Season.
Stir the porcini and soaking liquor into the garlic mushrooms. Add the lentils and warm through over a low heat; season. Serve with the polenta and a scattering of parsley.
